ygData.subject: Re: Stamina question??
ygData.msgSnippet: At level 15, my barbarian warrior has a 456 hit points and a stamina of 110.  I started out with 35 hit points, and from level 1 to 14 I gained exactly 30 hit
ygData.messageBody:
At level 15, my barbarian warrior has a 456 hit points and a stamina
of 110. I started out with 35 hit points, and from level 1 to 14 I gained
exactly 30 hit points per level. When I hit 15, I gained 31. If I ever
gain 16, I'll let you know the results. Hope this helps!


Angarth, Clan Anstruther, Warrior of the 15th Tier
"Periissem ni periisem"


> ----------
> From: Mifsud, Michael[SMTP:Michael.Mifsud@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 1:07 AM
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Stamina question??
>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
> Has anyone figured out how stamina affects hp?? I know at level one
> theres
> not much difference between the standard stamina and a bumped up stamina,
> but as the levels progress theres a BIG difference.
>
> Example compare your vanilla troll warrior and vanilla barbarian warrior.
> At level 20 the troll will have aprox 780hp at level 22 the barbarian will
> have aprox 666hp. Im taking this information from 2 people I know. So
> obviously the higher natural stamina does really affect hp over time.
>
> So has anyone figured out a ration? Or any word from Verant how it
> actually
> works? At the moment all we have (which is fine) is that more stamina =
> more hp at HIGHER levels. The higher the levels become the greater the
> divergence.
>
> Wonder if people would mind telling us there stamina, level and hp?
>
> My character has a stamina of 75 and at level 18 she has exactly 500hp.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------

> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
>
